avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. There is usually not enough snow for snow sports and avalanches can hardly be triggered.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Lack of snow and stones are the main dangers.

snowpackStructure.comment: There is no closed snow cover, snowpack and the terrain is mostly bare or there is a little new fallen snow on bare ground.

weatherForecast.comment: The sun will shine all day on Friday with good visibility. Residual clouds in Lungau will clear in the course of the morning. The wind will be light to moderate from different directions. At 2000 metres the temperature will be around 0 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is low. Small avalanches in particular can occasionally be triggered by one person in shady slope high alpine regions above 2600 metres. This occurs where the older foehn drift snow has formed a suitable shelf above a weak layer (usually in persistent weak layer). In addition to the risk of burial, the risk of falling and injury should be taken into account.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Rare avalanche prone locations in persistent weak layers of snow

snowpackStructure.comment: A little new fallen snow lies on a hard-frozen surface. On the sunny slopes, the snow cover, snowpack softens during the daytime changes. In high, shady slopes, the melt-freeze crust is partly covered by edged snow with no binding, which can serve as a weak layer in exceptional cases, but usually does not tend to propagate fractures. Fractures are most possible within the snow cover, above the hardness of the old snow foundation from early winter or in weak layers near crusts. The snow depth is well below average at all altitudes.

weatherForecast.comment: On Friday, the sun will shine all day with good visibility. The wind will be light to moderate from different directions. At 2000 metres the temperature will be around 0 degrees, at 3000 metres around -5 degrees Celsius.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. In gullies and bowls adjacent to the ridgeline, crests or summits in shady slopes, there are very isolated trigger points in persistent weak layers that are difficult to disturb. Only very rarely can drift snow packs be triggered there by individuals. Avalanches remain small.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Injury from stones and falling are the main dangers.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow depth is well below average for the time of year. There is little new fallen snow on a hard-frozen surface or on bare ground. On sunny slopes, the snow cover, snowpack softens during the daytime changes. At high altitudes on the shady slopes, weak layers of faceted crystals remain in the snow cover, mostly in the vicinity of crusts.

weatherForecast.comment: The sun will shine all day on Friday with good visibility. Residual clouds in Lungau will clear in the course of the morning. The wind will be weak to moderately strong from different directions. North of the main Alpine ridge the temperature will be around 0 degrees Celsius at 2000 metres and -5 degrees Celsius at 3000 metres, south of the ridge it will be around -2 degrees Celsius at 2000 metres and -7 degrees Celsius at 3000 metres.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: In high and high alpine, shady locations, isolated avalanche prone locations for a dry snow slab
